definitions.definition: annoyed by somebody/something, especially because you have to wait for a long time

examples.text: I'd been waiting for twenty minutes and I was getting impatient.
Try not to be too impatient with her.
Sarah was becoming increasingly impatient at their lack of interest.
An impatient driver behind me sounded his horn.
She waved them away with an impatient gesture.
Sometimes he is very impatient with his students.
She's getting impatient with the delays.

definitions.definition: wanting to do something soon; wanting something to happen soon
definitions.sensetop: impatient to do somethingimpatient for something

examples.text: She was clearly impatient to leave.

definitions.definition: unable or unwilling to accept something unpleasant

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the senses ‘lacking patience’ and ‘unbearable’): via Old French from Latin impatient- ‘not bearing, impatient’, from in- ‘not’ + pati ‘suffer, bear’ .
